soc.client

Class SquaresPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • soc.client.SquaresPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, ColorSquareListener

    class SquaresPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, ColorSquareListener
    Display grid of give/get resources for trade and bank/port offers. 2 rows of 5 columns of ColorSquareLarger: 1 column per resource type: Clay, ore, sheep, wheat, wood.
    Author:
    Robert S Thomas
    See Also:
    SOCHandPanel, TradePanel

    • Field Detail

      • WIDTH_PX

        public static final int WIDTH_PX
        Width of this panel, in unscaled pixels: 5 columns of ColorSquareLargers, which share 1 pixel overlap for squares' shared border.

        Before v2.4.50 this field was WIDTH.

        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HEIGHT_PX

        public static final int HEIGHT_PX
        Height of this panel, in unscaled pixels: 2 lines of ColorSquareLargers, which share 1 pixel overlap for squares' shared border.

        Before v2.4.50 this field was HEIGHT.

        Since:
        1.1.08
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SquaresPanel

        public SquaresPanel(boolean in,
                    int displayScale)
        Creates a new SquaresPanel object.
        Parameters:
        in - Interactive?
        displayScale - For high-DPI displays, what scaling factor to use? Unscaled is 1.

      • SquaresPanel

        public SquaresPanel(boolean in,
                    SOCHandPanel hand,
                    int displayScale)
        Creates a new SquaresPanel object, as part of a SOCHandPanel.
        Parameters:
        in - Interactive, not read-only? Can be changed later with setInteractive(boolean).
        hand - HandPanel containing this SquaresPanel
        displayScale - For high-DPI displays, what scaling factor to use? Unscaled is 1.
        Since:
        1.1.00

    • Method Detail

      • setInteractive

        public void setInteractive(boolean inter)
        Set this panel to interactive or read-only mode. If read-only, user can't click the resource amounts to change them.
        Parameters:
        inter - True for interactive, false for read-only
        See Also:
        2.0.00

      • setValues

        public void setValues(SOCResourceSet give,
                      SOCResourceSet get)
        Set or clear trading squares' values from resource set contents.
        Parameters:
        give - Trade resources to use in Line 1; will clear all to 0 if null
        get - Trade resources to use in Line 2; will clear all to 0 if null
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • squareChanged

        public void squareChanged(ColorSquare sq,
                          int oldValue,
                          int newValue)
        Called by colorsquare when clicked; if we're part of a HandPanel, could enable/disable its buttons based on new value. If needed, also call SOCHandPanel.sqPanelZerosChange(boolean) if parentHand is set.
        Specified by:
        squareChanged in interface ColorSquareListener
        Parameters:
        sq - The square being changed
        oldValue - The previous value before clicking
        newValue - The new value after clicking; for boolean squares, unchecked/no is 0 and checked/yes is 1.
        Since:
        1.1.00
